title: Texas sues TikTok for violating children's privacy
description: Paxton said TikTok, whose parent is China's ByteDance, does not provide tools to restrict children's privacy and account settings, even allowing information to be shared from accounts set to "private," and allows targeted advertising to children.
content: Texas sued TikTok on Thursday, accusing the social media platform of violating children's privacy and state law by sharing children's personal identifying information without consent from their parents or legal guardians.
cleaned_content: texas sued tiktok on thursday accusing the social media platform of violating childrens privacy and state law by sharing childrens personal identifying information without consent from their parents or legal guardians
